text: The first slides are a brief review of my previous presentation, which is about the fact that the phenomenon that screams to be recognized in nature, or for that matter in physics, is the appearance and then the evolution of the flow configuration.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The flow configuration, as you can see here, unites the animate with the inanimate.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: In other words, it does away with the dichotomy inherited from the church.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And with that idea going forward, everything that flows and moves on earth is driven by power, which comes from the consumption of fuel and food.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: There are flow architectures, most of them natural, that function as engines.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: For example, the atmosphere, the hydrosphere, all these things that move are driven by power.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And as they move and as they morph, they dissipate the power.

text: And I call the dissipated features breaks.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And on the right-hand side, you see a summary of everything, which means the geo, the bio, and the socio are morphing, meaning evolving flow architectures.

text: The statement that emerges after all these observations, again, is based on observations.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: In other words, this law of evolution in nature is of empirical origin like all laws of physics.

text: And it says that it actually defines the life state, which is our subject today.

text: For a flow system to persist in time, it must evolve with freedom such that it provides greater access.

text: So the phenomenon is the evolution of flowing form, which is actually the time arrow or the definition of future as something different than the present and the past.

text: The keywords are only two, the ones that will give us support in the conversation.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: So, the definition of evolution from the dictionary is changes that occur in a discernible direction in time.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: That direction is known by many names, objective, purpose, goal, but there are many other such words that represent common sense.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Freedom are physical features that allow an entity, we call that system and dynamics, to exhibit changes.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Freedom can be measured in terms of the number of degrees of freedom.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: For example, the piston moving in and out of the cylinder of the engine has one degree of freedom, which is the position of the piston.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Other configurations, the natural ones, have innumerable degrees of freedom.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: You can look at the direction in which your cat is moving.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: Anyway, the freedom description is a very thick book of examples.
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: The punchline is that without this physical feature called freedom, there can be no evolution and no design.

text: You can show easily that if a stream of a particular flow rate flows through two parallel tubes, meaning one stream divided to flow in parallel through those two tubes,
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: That stream flows a lot easier through a single tube with a flow volume equal to the sum of the previous two.

text: In the second example, if the flow is external to the solid walls, that is, for example, in two barges that are pulled up the river by two tugboats, well, the total load on those two barges is pulled a lot easier on a single barge that is bigger.

text: So, in going from left to right, in both examples, from left to right, it is easier to go from 2 to 1.

text: If that is so, then why is it that the flows everywhere around us are not of one big size?
speaker: SPEAKER_00

text: And the reason is that the flows on areas and inside of volumes, such as the animal body, are flows between one point in an area and one point in a volume.

text: This brings me to two examples of social organization and how it benefits from innovation.

text: The first example is a look at prehistory beginning from left to right in the vertical direction that Q

text: primitive population.

text: It means that on the abscissa, the direction of time from prehistory to modern times is from left to right.

text: Now, if you look at the piecewise linear curve that emerges, it starts on the left with the hunting and gathering, individuals living in huts, one pot of hot water, meaning on fire, for one particular hut.

text: and that pot leaks heat to the ambient, and that rate of heat leak is proportional to the Q on the ordinate.
